administrative adjective
(LOCAL GOVERNMENT)
relating to the organization and structure of local government: Brittany is a cultural and administrative region in the north-west of France. The villages had been omitted because they fell outside the administrative boundary of the region.
relating to the laws that control local government: In several countries, administrative law is distinguished from constitutional law by being concerned purely with matters of public administration. Review by an administrative tribunal is generally to determine whether a decision taken by an executive authority breaches procedural rules.
More examplesFewer examplesThis is the islands' main city and financial, governmental, and administrative centre.The county's administrative apparatus ranked among the least effective in the country.Labour law is a collection of precedents, administrative rulings, and laws that tackle the legal rights of organizations and their employees.
